特記事項: 【合併】Management of International Organizations（大学院共通科目・認定科目前期）/Management of International Organizations（国際学研究科前期課程）
関連科目: Career seminar for international organizations, Internship in UN and Diplomatic Institutions
授業方法: Online classes will be organized during COVID-19 crisis. Lecture and seminar discussions

第1回:
4/9 Kukita: Introduction and overview of the class, objectives, expectations by students.
Broad overview of international organizations including the UN system, international financial institutions, OECD, and other regional organizations.
Defining organizational mandate,
United Nations Charter,
Defining roles of agencies, UNICEF and WHO
Pre-assignment: Read the Preamble to Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter, and search for the mandate of UNICEF and WHO respectively.
第2回:
4/16 Kukita: Management of the UN General Assembly
Role and functions of the secretariat, President, member countries
Pre-assignment: Read relevant chapters of the United Nations Charter
第3回:
4/23 Kukita: Governance mechanisms and structure of UN agencies: Executive Board. Executive Director
Aligning organizational goals with UN goals
Medium term strategic plan
Budget formulation
Kukita: Staff issues and risk management:
Human resources development
Succession plan
Risk assessment and business continuity plan
Pre-assignment: Students search for UNICEF Executive Board Document and read the latest programme of work
第4回:
4/30 Kukita: Strategy and programme development:
Country level programme cycle, UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework, enterprize risk management
Country programme development, operational alignment
Pre-assignment: Students search for UNICEF Executive Board Document and read one of country programme recommendations
第5回: 5/7 Prof. Shimizu: Management issues of UNHCR including security risk management, stress management, and programme criticality assessment
Pre-assignment: Students search on management issues related to UNHCR
第6回: 5/14  Prof. Murata: Management of UN regional commissions
ESCAP in the context of the Asia Pacific Forum of Sustainable Development
第7回:
5/21 Prof. Shinyo: Management of the mission to UN
Purpose, key roles and functions of the mission
Liaison with the UN
Liaison and cooperation with other missions
Reading Materials to be provided in advance of the class
第8回:
5/28 Prof. Shinyo: Management of the UN Security Council
Role and functions of the secretariat, P5s, Non-Permanent members, Process management
Pre-assignment: Read relevant chapters of the United Nations Charter
第9回:
6/4_Kukita:Resource mobilization and fundraising:
Leveraging and advocacy, Fundraising strategies and principles
Cases: Polio eradication and Indian Ocean Tsunami emergencies
Pre-assignment: Students search for UNICEF Annual Report and identify who are the main donors to UNICEF and how UNICEF raise funds.
第10回:
6/11 Prof. T. Niwa
Overview of the UN and UN Development System: Autonomy and Independence of UN Organizations; Typologies of UN organizations;
Management Accountability; Need for Coordination.

Pre-assignment:
Students search for the United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination (CEB) and its work
第11回:
6/18 Prof. T. Niwa
Inter-Agency Coordination at the
Global Level, viz. Chief Executive Board (CEB), HLCM, HLCP, UN DG, ECHA; ‘Common Gateways’, including ACABQ, the 5th Committee, and ICSC); Coordination at the Country Level; Management of Post Conflict Situations, including Coordination between Peacekeeping Operations and UN Country Team.
第12回:
6/25 Prof. T. Niwa
UN Country Office and Program Management: Examples of Yemen, Nepal and Thailand;
Aid Coordination within and without the UN System; Disaster Relief Coordination; Examples of Yemen and Nepal.
UNDP HQ Management Issues: Management Accountability; Challenges
第13回:
7/2 Prof. T. Niwa
UN HQ Management Issues; Chief Procurement Officer; UN Common Service; Capital Master Plan; Relations with the Host City/ Government.
UNICEF Management Issues: Strengthening of Internal Management, including Management Accountability; UNICEF and the UN Reform.
Post-UN: Election Observation to Nepal; Use of the African Union for UN peacekeeping; Mentoring of Peacekeeping Personnel; Strengthening of the Functioning of the UN General Assembly President’s Office
第14回:
7/9 Prof. Kukita:
Students' presentation on specific management issues at UN, evaluation of the course
Pre-assignment: Students prepare final presentations on specific management issues at UN
